bibl.title: Letter from Robert Bristow to Robert Carter, 1718 October 2

div1.p: Merchant Robert Bristow writes from London to Robert Carter, October 2, 1718, that he intends to try longer to make a good profit from his Fleets Bay plantation, but should he decide to sell it, he will contact Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Bristow to Robert Carter, October 2, 1718
div1.p:
I received your favour in Relation to my disposing of fleetsbay
Plantation, the reason of my thinking so was from the small advantage
I have made of it to what my Grandfather did in his time. I bleive
were it rightly managed it mought be worth something more
thn Pastorage, I intend to trye a little longer to see how it may answer
before I determine to dispose of it when tht resolution is taken
you shall be sure to know of itt. belive me
div1.closer:
Sr Yours
R[OBERT] B[RISTOW]
Per the Carter

div1.head: NOTES
